Module AOOP_Project
Package domain

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
domain.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Controller extends Object implements Serializable
Controller is used to control every class. Keeps track of the Gameboard, Player position, Crate Positions and the winning condition.
Author:
Senne Dierick, Michael Unterberger
See Also:

      Class Constructor

  • Method Details

    • setViewStrategy

      public void setViewStrategy(domain.ViewStrategy vs)
      Sets the Viewing Strategy of the current State of the game.
      Parameters:
      vs - the desired viewing strategy

    • getViewerType

      public Class<?> getViewerType()
      This returns the Class type of the current ViewStrategy, it is used by other classes to determine which viewing strategy is in use at the moment.
      Returns:
      Class type of the current viewerStrategy

    • checkEndConditions

      public boolean checkEndConditions()
      Checks if the endConditions are met. It traverses through the crates array and checks if all the Crates are in position.
      Returns:
      if game has been won

    • loadBoard

      public void loadBoard(boolean prefix)
      This function is called after the user chooses the level on a BeginScreen to create the level.
      Parameters:
      prefix - set for special pathing on different machines

    • attachGameboardObserver

      public void attachGameboardObserver(GameboardObserver gb)
      This function attaches a new GameboardObserver to the ObserverList. It will get notified when the Gameboard changes.
      Parameters:
      gb - the gameboard observer to attach

    • attachMoveObserver

      public void attachMoveObserver(ActionObserver ao)
      This function attaches an observer to the observer list, which get notified when the user inputs something.
      Parameters:
      ao - ActionObserver that gets notified when the user inputs something

    • updateView

      public void updateView()
      This function causes the currently used viewer to update the Game-View.

    • getGameBoard

      public GameBoard getGameBoard()
      Gets the gameBoard as a 2D-Array of tiles.
      Returns:
      the gameBoard

    • getGameboardObservers

      public List<GameboardObserver> getGameboardObservers()
      Gets a list of the GameboardObservers. Is used by the GUI-viewing strategy.
      Returns:
      the observers

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(MoveDirection d)
      This function moves the player to the right. It checks if there is a Crate to the right that he can push. Also if there is a wall the player can't move. The crate and character position and view will be updated if the gamestate changes and it will be checked if the player won the game.
      Parameters:
      d - direction of movement

    • setSelectedLevel

      public void setSelectedLevel(int selectedLevel)
      sets the currently selected level
      Parameters:
      selectedLevel - currently selected level

    • isKeyboardOn

      public boolean isKeyboardOn()
      returns the value representing if the user has selected if the keyboard should be used
      Returns:
      if keybpoard is on

    • setKeyboardOn

      public void setKeyboardOn(boolean keyboardOn)
      sets the variable for the use of keyboard
      Parameters:
      keyboardOn - boolean that holds value for keyboard use

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame(boolean prefix)
      Saves the current game state to a file
      Parameters:
      prefix - set for special pathing on different machines

    • resetGameboard

      public void resetGameboard()
      this function resets the Current games gameboard back to starting conditions. This is called when the user presses "Space" or when he uses the reset button. The view gets updated when calling this function.
